citation.article-title: Methanococcus frisius sp. nov., a new methylotrophic marine methanogen.

p.s: Description of Methanococcus frisius sp. nov.
Methanococcus frisius (fri.si.us., L. masc. adj. frisius pertaining to Frisia, a region in the northwest of the Federal Republic of Germany)
Cells occur singly or in pairs.
Extremely sensitive to detergents (Triton X-100, SDS).
Grown in a defined mineral medium with H2 + CO2, methanol or methylamines.
Formate and acetate do not serve as substrates for growth and CH4 formation.
Sodium chloride (optimum 2%) is required for growth.
DNA Base Composition: the mol% G+C is 38.2 ± 1.0.
Source: Isolated from shoal mud of the Leybucht (North Sea of the Federal Republic of Germany).
Strain Deposition: The type strain Methanococcus frisius is strain C 16.
This strain has been deposited with the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen (DSM), 3400 Göttingen, F.R.G. (=DSM 3318).
